ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
This course offered a unique and immersive approach to learning Spanish by centering discussions around critical topics pertinent to the Spanish-speaking community, including immigration, women in the arts, indigenous communities, and Afro-Latino experiences. The emphasis on practical application over traditional grammar-focused lessons fostered a dynamic learning environment. This approach not only enhanced my linguistic skills but also deepened my understanding of important cultural and social issues.

The course structure, which prioritized project-based assignments, was particularly effective. It allowed for the practical application of language skills in meaningful contexts, making the learning process more engaging and relevant. This hands-on method helped in solidifying my language proficiency and in gaining a richer perspective on the issues discussed.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This was the best spanish course I have ever taken in terms of engagement, Sebastian was amazing.

I really like the content of the course. The topics about immigration, Afro-latino and indigenous community, and art were super cool. I still think they need to have some more emphasis of grammar. I understand trying to teach us these things just through exposure to content and materials, but there was never any explicit teaching on grammar. I think this method takes a lot longer than it would if everything was just explained to us outright. Also, I don't know if there is a difference in professor or what, but I think the expectations of writing expression between L3 and L4 are really far apart. That was quite frustrating.

Strengths of the Course:
This course stands out for its innovative approach to language learning, blending a diverse array of engaging and relevant content. The variety of materials used not only makes the learning process more interesting but also ensures that the knowledge gained is meaningful and applicable. This creative mix of content caters to different learning styles and keeps the course dynamic and engaging.

Areas for Improvement:
While the course's pace contributes to its dynamic nature, it occasionally moves too swiftly, which can hinder optimal engagement with the various materials presented. Slowing down the pace slightly could allow for deeper exploration and understanding of each topic, ensuring that students fully absorb and appreciate the richness of the material. A more measured pace could also facilitate a more thorough discussion and interaction with the content, thereby enhancing the overall learning experience.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely if you want to improve fleuncy
I'd recommend this course to a student. It is required in moving along the Spanish learning sequence. I'd say this course is really valuable and is a good build-up from the previous Spanish classes.
